plot: A new witness comes forward claiming to have crucial evidence in Gail Vella's murder. Kate is torn between her loyalty to Jo and to AC-12.

On the strength of evidence from a new witness, DCI Jo Davidson brings Terry Boyle back in for questioning about Gail Vella's murder. Kate is torn between loyalty to Jo and wanting to assist AC-12's investigation, and tensions increase when Kate encounters a face from the past with links to organised crime.

After a witness states Boyle argued with the deceased CHIS regarding Vella's murder, brought in for further questioning he nearly shares new information about a man who "did [the murder]", but Davidson halts the interview. Accompanying PC Lisa Patel who is driving Boyle home, constable Ryan Pilkington, diverts to a different route, forces the car into a reservoir, drowns reemerging Patel but can't drown Boyle as unsuspecting Fleming, who tailed them, arrives, notices a window in the vehicle where Pilkington was sitting is open, and reports her findings to AC-12. Arnott recognizes Pilkington and Fleming remembers interviewing him as a juvenile connected with an old AC-12 case. Steph tells Hastings of Arnott's painkiller addiction; Arnott fails to get clean, spends a platonic night with Steph, he searches her house; discovering much cash in the loft. Boyle's freezer is found in a dump, containing samples of Jackie Laverty's blood. In Brentiss Prison, Jatri is violently prevented from talking to AC-12 by an OCG warder breaking her wrist. DSU Buckells and witness Deborah Devereux, who named Boyle, were sex partners. Buckells is handed over to AC-12, his Interim successor Davidson messages an unknown, unresponsive individual on a laptop 'everything has been taken care of'.—KGF Vissers
